meanings.definition: A person who denies or contradicts something.
meanings.sent1: The negaters in the group always find a reason to disagree.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the ultimate negaters in the debate club.
meanings.sent3: The negaters at the meeting kept shaking their heads in disbelief.
meanings.sent4: Her brother was a professional negaters, always challenging her ideas.
meanings.sent5: The negaters' constant skepticism made it hard to reach a consensus.

meanings.definition: A device or mechanism that cancels out or neutralizes something.
meanings.sent1: The noise-cancelling headphones acted as effective negaters of outside sounds.
meanings.sent2: The scientist invented a new type of negaters to block harmful radiation.
meanings.sent3: The negaters on the machine malfunctioned, causing chaos in the lab.
meanings.sent4: The negaters in the circuit prevented the overload of electricity.
meanings.sent5: The negaters successfully blocked the interference, allowing clear communication.

meanings.definition: To deny the truth or validity of something.
meanings.sent1: He always negaters any criticism directed towards him.
meanings.sent2: She tends to negaters any evidence that goes against her beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The child tried to negaters his involvement in the cookie jar incident.
meanings.sent4: The defendant continued to negaters his guilt despite the overwhelming proof.
meanings.sent5: The politician's attempt to negaters the scandal only made matters worse.
